title: 104_s1174
content: The Act may be cited as the "Lamprey Wild and Scenic River Act". Congress finds that the Lamprey River Study Act of 1991 authorized the study of a segment of the Lamprey River in New Hampshire for potential inclusion in the National Wild and Scenic Rivers System. The study determined that a specific segment of the river is eligible for inclusion based on its free-flowing condition and ecological, fish, and historical values. The Lamprey River Advisory Committee, with assistance from the National Park Service and the New Hampshire Department of Environmental Services, prepared during the study. The Lamprey River Management Plan, dated January 10, 1995, establishes objectives, standards, and action programs for long-term protection of the river's values. The Lamprey River Advisory Committee unanimously voted for wild and scenic river designation, endorsed by the governing bodies of Newmarket, Durham, and Lee. Durham and Lee endorse the Lamprey River Management Plan and seek National Wild and Scenic Rivers System designation. Epping, an upstream town, chooses not to vote on the plan at this time. The Lamprey River Management Plan is endorsed by Durham and Lee, seeking National Wild and Scenic Rivers System designation. Epping chooses not to vote on the plan at this time. The Wild and Scenic Rivers Act is amended to designate a 11.5-mile segment of the Lamprey River in New Hampshire as a recreational river. The segment will be managed through cooperative agreements between the Secretary of the Interior, the State of New Hampshire, and the towns of Durham, Lee, and Newmarket. It will be managed according to the Lamprey River Management Plan dated January 10, 1995. The plan shall meet the requirements for a comprehensive management plan under the Act. SEC. 4. MANAGEMENT. The Secretary of the Interior will coordinate management responsibilities with the Lamprey River Advisory Committee. Zoning ordinances in certain towns will meet standards for conservation. Acquisition of lands will follow specified provisions. The Secretary can acquire lands for the segment with consent of the owner and following the Lamprey River Management Plan. The Secretary of the Interior will provide assistance to the town of Epping, New Hampshire, for their involvement in the Lamprey River Management Plan and potential addition of the river to the National Wild and Scenic Rivers System. Authorization of appropriations is granted for the implementation of this Act.
